text: Raw materials required by green plants to manufacture their food are
The role of ATP include all the following activities except

options.A: provision of energy to do work in living organisms
options.C: keeping the body warm in homoithermic animals

explanation:
The correct answer is D
Although, ATP (Adenosine Triphosphate) is not directly involved in the transmission of nerve impulses. Nerve impulses are transmitted through electrical and chemical signals, such as action potentials and neurotransmitters. However, producing water during aerobic respiration isn't the primary role of ATP; rather, ATP is the energy currency of the cell, while water is a byproduct of the electron transport chain, a key step in aerobic respiration.

Which of the following statements is true about movement of the forearm? In

options.A: bending the arm, the biceps relax and the triceps contract
options.B: bending the arm, the biceps contract and the triceps relax
options.C: straightening the arm the biceps contract and the triceps relax
options.D: straightening the arm, both biceps and triceps contract

explanation: To bend the arm, the biceps contracts and pulls on the radius. Simultaneously, the triceps relaxes.

text: Only specially adapted micro-organisms are found in
Which of the following organisms causes syphilis?
In plant respiration occurs in
explanation: Respiration in plants does not solely occur through stomata and lenticels. While these structures are important for gas exchange, every plant part, including leaves, stems, and roots, participates in respiration, albeit at different rates. Plants do not have specialized respiratory organs like humans, but they use their various parts for gaseous exchange.

options.C: Sunlight causes the stomata on the upper surface to close
options.D: stomata are not present on the upper surface of a leaf

text: When both ovaries of the human female ovulate simultaneously and both ova are fertilized, then

text: Which of the following statements is not true of the light stage of photosynthesis?

options.B: Water molecules split into hydrogen and hydroxyl ions
options.C: Carbon (IV) oxide is reduced by hydrogen atoms in NADPH2

explanation:
Dark Reaction is the second step in the mechanism of photosynthesis.
The chemical processes of photosynthesis occurring independently of light are called dark reactions. It takes place in the stroma of the chloroplast.Dark reactions of photosynthesis are chemical reactions that convert carbon dioxide and other compounds into glucose. So dark reaction is an enzymatic phase of photosynthesis.

text: Variation which exhibits a wide range from one extreme to the other with very little difference between the intermediates is described as
Which of the following is an example of physiological variation?
explanation: Physiological variation refers to the differences in the ways individuals of the same species behave or react to conditions in their environment. In other words, it relates to the functioning of the body. Examples include; Behaviour, ability to roll the tongue, ability to taste a chemical substance called PTC, differences in Blood group etc
